perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Sweden.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the governing law from Japan to Sweden, Article 3 introduces potential legal risks and contradictions. While both countries have established legal systems, their specific consumer protection laws, contract enforcement mechanisms, and dispute resolution processes differ. This alteration could potentially void or negatively impact consumer rights if the original agreement provided protections under Japanese law that are not available under Swedish law, or if the involved parties are located in different jurisdictions from Sweden.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies based on the specific clause and comparison between Japanese and Swedish law regarding consumer protection, contract law, and international jurisdiction.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement of Directors and Officers with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of "cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to" and the removal of "(except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA), as applicable," weakens the obligation of the Nissin Parties to ensure that VNBJ and VNBZ provide indemnification and reimbursement to all Directors and Officers, and removes the specification of not indemnifying resigning individuals. This may contradict laws which mandate the protection of company directors and officers from liabilities incurred during their tenure, and the removal of excluding indemnifying resigning directors could contradict laws regarding corporate governance and liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially contradicts corporate governance laws in Japan or China (where VNBJ and VNBZ are located, respectively) regarding director and officer liability and indemnification.
